page.title: 01THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY ENTRY
page.content: THE SIBFORD D-BLOCK IS COUNTRYSIDE. FARMS & FARMERS DOMINATE THE AREA. THE VILLAGES OF TADMARTON,WIGGINTON,HOOK NORTON,SIBFORD FERRIS & SIBFORD GOWER ALL FEATURED IN 1066 DOMESDAY BOOK. TADMARTON(TADMERTONE) WAS THE SITE OF A ROMAN FORT WHICH CAN PARTLY BE SEEN TODAY ON USHERCOMBE FARM. WIGGINTON (WIGENTONE) WAS PROBABLY PRE-ROMAN, THE SETTLEMENT OF AN ANCIENT TRIBE. HOOK NORTON(HOCHENARTONE) BEGAN ON THE SITE OF A BATTLEFIELD.IN 912 ROLLO THE DANE FOUGHT'A SORE AND BLOODY BATTEL'. TODAY IT IS FAMOUS FOR ITS ALES BREWED IN THE VILLAGE AND THE PILLARS FROM THE RAILWAY VIADUCT, ANOTHER RELIC FROM A BYGONE AGE. THE SIBFORDS ARE TWIN VILLAGES ACROSS THE VALLEY DATING FROM 1066.THE FERRIS HOUSES SIBFORD FRIENDS SCHOOL ESTABLISHED IN 1842 & FLOURISHING TODAY WITH 350 PUPILS & 37 TEACHING STAFF - OUR SCHOOL!
